title: Reading 1: Weather in Different Countries

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in Thailand?
subQuestions.explanation: Looking at the picture for Thailand, you can see rain falling and a person holding an umbrella. This indicates rainy weather.

subQuestions.q: What is the weather like in Kuwait?
subQuestions.explanation: The picture for Kuwait shows a bright sun and a thermometer with a high temperature. There is no rain or snow shown. Thus, it is hot and sunny.

title: Reading 2: City Weather Chart

subQuestions.q: Ernie lives in City C. What might he say?
options: (A) It snows a lot in January here.
(B) It's cool and rainy in July.
(C) We have a lot of rain in April.
(D) It's windy and snowy in October.
subQuestions.explanation: Check the chart for City C. In April, the symbol shows a cloud with rain. Therefore, Ernie would say they have rain in April.

subQuestions.q: Tony lives in City A, and it is a sunny day today. What month is it now?
subQuestions.explanation: Look at the row for City A. The symbol for July is a sun, representing sunny weather. Other months show clouds or rain.

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in April in City B?
subQuestions.explanation: Find the intersection of City B and April. The symbol is an umbrella with raindrops, which means it is rainy.

title: Reading 3: Trip to Kenting
article:
Ken: Hey, Amy. That's an orange coat. Why are you in it? You hate the color.
Amy: Well, it's so cold today and my jacket isn't warm enough. I want to go to a warm place this weekend. Do you have any ideas?
Ken: What about Kenting? It is always sunny there.
Amy: That's great.
Ken: I have some good friends there. Let's visit them.
Amy: Cool! You sent me postcards from Kenting before, and I'll send my family some this time.

subQuestions.q: Why does Amy wear a coat?
options: (C) Amy likes the coat very much.
(D) She wants to go to Kenting.
subQuestions.explanation: Amy explicitly says, 'it's so cold today and my jacket isn't warm enough.' That is why she is wearing the coat.

subQuestions.q: Why do Ken and Amy want to go to Kenting?
subQuestions.explanation: Ken suggests Kenting because 'It is always sunny there,' and Amy agrees because she wants a warm place.

subQuestions.q: Which is true?
options: (B) It is always cold in Kenting.
(C) It is snowy in Kenting this weekend.
(D) Ken has some friends in Kenting.
subQuestions.explanation: Ken says, 'I have some good friends there.' This makes option (D) correct.

title: Reading 4: Four Cities Weather

subQuestions.q: Eric lives in City 3, and it snows a lot. What season is it now?
subQuestions.explanation: In the chart for City 3, the Winter column shows a snowman, which indicates snow.

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in City 2 in autumn?
subQuestions.explanation: In the chart for City 2, the 'Fall' (Autumn) column shows a sun symbol, meaning it is sunny.

title: Reading 5: Visiting Yilan
article:
Mia: Do you know Yilan?
Ben: Yes, it rains very often in winter.
Mia: How's the weather there in summer?
Ben: It's always hot and wet, but many people like Yilan a lot.
Mia: You're right. My parents and I sometimes have trips to Yilan.
Ben: What do you do there?
Mia: We visit our grandparents and join Children's Folklore and Folkgame Festival. We always have a good time.
Ben: That's cool!
Mia: These are for you. Some snacks from Yilan!
Ben: Thanks!

subQuestions.q: What's the weather like in Yilan in winter?
subQuestions.explanation: Ben says, 'Yes, it rains very often in winter.' So the weather is rainy.

subQuestions.q: Why do Mia and her parents go to Yilan?
options: (B) They have a snack shop there.
subQuestions.explanation: Mia mentions, 'We visit our grandparents...'

title: Reading 6: Australian Summer
article:
(Cody is talking to his friend from Australia.)
Cody: Do you like the weather in Taiwan?
Tony: Of course. You know what? I had two summers in a year, and I enjoyed lots of sunny days.
Cody: What do you mean?
Tony: My first summer was from December to February in Australia, and my second summer was from June to August in Taiwan. I'm a summer guy, so I love it.
Cody: That's great. How about the food in Taiwan? Do you like it?
Tony: Yeah! I went to a night market with some mates the other day. We had fried chook. It was great.
Cody: I didn't get it. Who did you go to the night market with, and what did you have?
Tony: Sorry about my Australian English. I went with some friends, and we had fried chicken.
Cody: I see. I learned some Australian English today!
Tony: Good for you! Maybe you can come see me in Australia next year, and we can have fun together.

subQuestions.q: What did Tony say about Australia's summer?
options: (A) It is usually about four months long.
(B) It is cool and doesn't have many sunny days.
(C) It has strange weather, so he hates it.
(D) It falls in different months from Taiwan's summer.
subQuestions.explanation: Tony explains that Australia's summer is from December to February, which is different from Taiwan's summer (June to August).

subQuestions.q: Why did Cody say I didn't get it?
options: (B) He didn't like the weather in Taiwan.
(C) He didn't know much about Australian English.
(D) He didn't go to Australia before.
subQuestions.explanation: Tony used Australian slang like 'mates' and 'fried chook', which Cody didn't understand until Tony explained it meant 'friends' and 'fried chicken'.

title: Reading 7: Letters
article:
Dear Mom,
I know you are busy working in Taipei, but I have a big problem about my new school. I need your help.
I am afraid of talking to my new classmates. I got into the class for two weeks, but I have no friends to talk to. I usually feel lonely, and I don't like new school life. What can I do?
Sam

******************

My dear boy,
I know it's difficult to be a transfer student, but I am sure you can do it in a good way. Don't just wait for your classmates to talk to you. You can hold out your hand to them.
Be nice to people around you, and they will be nice to you. By the way, I will come back to Tainan next Saturday evening. We can have a big dinner.
Mom
Sandra

subQuestions.q: Why DOESN'T Sam like his new school life?
options: (A) Because he doesn't like his teachers.
(D) Because he doesn't live near the school.
subQuestions.explanation: Sam writes, 'I have no friends to talk to. I usually feel lonely.'

subQuestions.q: What is the relationship between Sam and Sandra?
subQuestions.explanation: Sam addresses the letter to 'Dear Mom', and Sandra calls him 'My dear boy'.

subQuestions.q: Which is right about the e-mails?
options: (B) Sandra will come back to Taipei next Saturday.
(C) Sam's new school is in Tainan.
(D) Sam lives with her mom in Taipei.
subQuestions.explanation: Sandra writes, 'I will come back to Tainan next Saturday evening.' This implies Sam is currently in Tainan attending his new school.

title: Reading 8: Postcard from Evans

subQuestions.q: What does it mean in the reading?
subQuestions.explanation: Evans writes: 'Theo and I bought bags... I bought one for you... It is big and special.' Here 'It' refers to the bag.

subQuestions.q: Where did Evans send the postcard to?
subQuestions.explanation: The address on the postcard is 'Taipei 106, Taiwan (ROC)'.

subQuestions.q: What do we know from the reading?
options: (A) Evans liked the trip in India.
(B) Evans went to India with Matt.
(D) Evans stood for seven hours on the train.
subQuestions.explanation: Evans says, 'India is a really beautiful place' and 'The weather is just lovely,' indicating he liked the trip.

title: Reading 9: Brazil and Taiwan
article: Brazil and Taiwan have different summer weather. First, Brazil's summer is from December to February, but Taiwan's summer is from June to September. In Brazil, the weather is hot and wet, with days around 30 to 35°C. Taiwan is also hot, around 28 to 35°C. Also, Brazil has a lot of rain. Taiwan has a lot of rain too, but typhoons are a big problem. They come with strong winds and heavy rain. Both places are hot and wet in summer.

subQuestions.q: What can be the title of this reading?
options: (A) Hot Summer and the Weather in the World
(B) The Summer Weather in Taiwan and Brazil
(C) Heavy Rain and Strong Typhoons in Taiwan
(D) Brazil Has Different Weather in Different Places
subQuestions.explanation: The text compares the summer weather conditions of Brazil and Taiwan.

subQuestions.q: Which of the following places may be Brazil?
subQuestions.explanation: Brazil's summer is Dec-Feb with high heat and rain. Graph (D) shows high temperatures and rainfall during these months.

subQuestions.q: Which of the following can we put in the middle?
subQuestions.explanation: The common feature (middle of Venn diagram) mentioned in the text is that 'Both places are hot and wet in summer'.

title: Reading 10: Steven's Letter

subQuestions.q: How was the weather in Australia during Steven's trip?
subQuestions.explanation: Steven writes, 'it was cold and snowy!'

subQuestions.q: Who did Steven meet in Australia?
subQuestions.explanation: Steven mentions Uncle Ben and Aunt Holly, staying at their house and doing activities with them.

subQuestions.q: Which is NOT right?
options: (A) Steven had a good time in Australia.
(B) Aunt Holly gave a jacket to Steven.
(C) Uncle Ben bought pictures of a cute baby for Steven.
(D) Steven played with snow in high mountains.
subQuestions.explanation: The text says 'they showed me some old pictures', not that Uncle Ben 'bought' them for Steven.

title: Reading 11: Homonyms
article:
Hi, everyone. Today's English class is about homonyms. Before we talk about homonyms, let's read a story first.
It was a cold and rainy night. Jasper was on his way home. There was an old man walking in front of him. "Watch out!" said Jasper to the old man when he saw a car. But, it was too late. The car hit the old man, and he lost his left arm and left leg. A few weeks later, Jasper saw the old man on the street again. "Hey, are you okay?" Jasper walked to the old man. "Well, I am all right now," said the old man. He showed Jasper his right arm and right leg.
In the story, the "right" in "all right" and the "right" in "his right arm and right leg" are homonyms. They have the same spelling but do not mean the same thing. One is "fine" or "okay," and the other is "on the right hand side." Now, can you think of another example of homonyms?

subQuestions.q: What do we know from the story?
options: (B) Jasper's car hit the old man.
(C) The weather that night was nice.
(D) The old man only has one arm and one leg now.
subQuestions.explanation: The story says the old man lost his left arm and leg, implying he only has the right ones remaining.

subQuestions.q:
Which uses homonyms?
a. What do you call hot snow? Water.
b. Why wasn't the moon hungry? Because it was full.
c. Why does every girl hate the sun? Because it is not cool.
d. What goes up when the rain comes down? An umbrella.
subQuestions.explanation: 'Full' (not hungry vs. moon phase) and 'Cool' (temperature vs. popular) are homonyms. The others are just riddles.

title: Reading 12: Sally and Eric
article:
Sally: How's your trip to Kaohsiung?
Eric: Very good. It is hot and sunny.
Sally: Really? It rains a lot in Keelung today.
Eric: Is it cold and windy, too?
Sally: Yes, we have heavy rain and strong winds. I visited my grandmother this morning. She lives on the next street. I hate rainy days. How about you?
Eric: I love walking in the rain, but there isn't much rain here in winter.
Sally: Well, I don't like the rain.
Eric: Let's visit Kaohsiung together next time. I can show you around. It is always sunny here.
Sally: Great! That's kind of you!

subQuestions.q: How is the weather at Sally's place?
subQuestions.explanation: Sally mentions, 'It rains a lot in Keelung today.'

subQuestions.q: What does Eric like?
subQuestions.explanation: Eric says, 'I love walking in the rain.'

subQuestions.q: Which is true?
options: (A) Sally likes the rain very much.
(B) Eric will visit Sally this weekend.
(C) It is always sunny in Kaohsiung.
(D) There is no rain in Keelung today.
subQuestions.explanation: Eric states, 'It is always sunny here [Kaohsiung].'

title: Reading 13: Grandma's Birthday Diary
article:
Apr. 24, Friday, 2020
I visited Grandma today. Aunt Sharon, Uncle Tom and Vicky were also there because it was Grandma's birthday. Aunt Sharon made a big chocolate cake for Grandma. It was beautiful, and Grandma liked it a lot! Uncle Tom just came back from Japan. He bought us cookies from Japan and showed us the pictures during his trip. Uncle Jack went on a business trip to Australia and didn't join us. He sent Grandma a postcard and a cool jacket as her birthday gift. Vicky and I made Grandma a cute birthday card. We saw a big smile on Grandma's face all day today.

subQuestions.q: How was the weather?
subQuestions.explanation: The image in the original text (implied by context) showed a Sun and 2°C, meaning cold but sunny.

subQuestions.q: What did Aunt Sharon make for the writer's grandma?
subQuestions.explanation: Aunt Sharon made a big chocolate cake.

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) The writer's grandma got a postcard from Japan.
(B) Vicky visited her uncle in Australia.
(C) Uncle Tom showed a jacket to everyone.
(D) Vicky and the writer made a card for the writer's grandma.
subQuestions.explanation: The writer says, 'Vicky and I made Grandma a cute birthday card.'

title: Reading 14: Tony's Message

subQuestions.q: What did Tony buy for Vivian?
subQuestions.explanation: Tony writes, 'I got a cute pencil for you'.

subQuestions.q: What does fantastic mean?
subQuestions.explanation: The food was 'yummy and beautiful', so fantastic means 'Great'.

subQuestions.q: What might Jimmy write on the postcard?
options: (A) Hi, Aunt Vivian, Dad and I are in Japan now...
(B) Dear Vivian, How are you doing? I got your postcard...
(C) Aunt Vivian, How's everything? Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi loved the cake...
(D) Dear Vivian, How's the weather there? It's windy...
subQuestions.explanation: Option (A) accurately describes the trip details mentioned in Tony's message (snowboard, pencil for Vivian, jackets from Horiuchi).

title: Reading 15: Chat Group

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in Japan today?
subQuestions.explanation: Ben (in Japan) says it's cold and the wind is strong, but no snow.

subQuestions.q: Who CAN'T enjoy the white Christmas this year?
subQuestions.explanation: Kelly says she has to work and can't go to New York.

subQuestions.q: What place is there?
subQuestions.explanation: Context implies visiting Derek in New York.

subQuestions.q: Which is true?
options: (B) It is snowy in Japan in November.
(C) Yuki can meet Ben in the USA on Christmas.
(D) Ben can stay in Derek's place, but Yuki can't.
subQuestions.explanation: Yuki and Ben both plan to visit Derek in New York (USA) for Christmas.

title: Reading 16: Jane and Douglas
article:
Jane: How many seasons are there in a year?
Douglas: There are four.
Jane: Which one do you like most?
Douglas: I like the winter.
Jane: Why? Don't you feel cold and bad in winter?
Douglas: I don't like hot weather. I like cold weather.
Jane: I hate cold days.
Douglas: I'll visit my aunt in Singapore this winter. It is usually warm in winter. Do you want to take a trip to Singapore with me?
Jane: Sounds like a good idea!
Douglas: I usually have a good time there. My aunt, uncle and cousins are nice. Look! This is a picture of them.
Jane: Wow! Your cousins are so cute!
Douglas: You're right.
Jane: Why were you in a pink T-shirt? You don't like pink.
Douglas: It's my uncle's. I didn't bring enough T-shirts with me.

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (B) The pink T-shirt was a birthday gift from Douglas' uncle.
subQuestions.explanation: Douglas explicitly states, 'I'll visit my aunt in Singapore this winter.'

subQuestions.q: Jane thought it sounded like a good idea to have a trip to Singapore in winter. Why?
options: (B) It's warm in Singapore in winter.
(D) She usually has a good time there.
subQuestions.explanation: Jane hates cold days, and Douglas mentions Singapore is warm in winter, which appeals to her.

title: Reading 17: Vincent and Lillian
article:
Vincent: What do you do on weekends?
Lillian: I usually play basketball with my classmates. How about you?
Vincent: My parents and I often fly a kite at the beach.
Lillian: How's the weather today?
Vincent: It is warm but windy.
Lillian: Great! Let's go fly a kite now.
Vincent: OK! But we need to take our umbrellas.
Lillian: Why?
Vincent: The weather report says it will be rainy later.
Lillian: Oh, no. Then, how about going to a movie?
Vincent: That's fine with me.

subQuestions.q: Lillian said, "Let's go fly a kite now." Why?
options: (C) Because Vincent gave her a kite.
(D) Because her classmates are flying a kite.
subQuestions.explanation: Kites need wind to fly, and Vincent just mentioned it is 'warm but windy'.

subQuestions.q: What are Vincent and Lillian going to do later?
options: (A) Watch the weather report on TV.
subQuestions.explanation: They decide to go to a movie because it will rain later.

subQuestions.q: What might the weather report say?
options: (A) It's a hot sunny day today...
(B) There's a lot of rain all day...
(C) It's warm but windy early this morning, but there's rain later...
subQuestions.explanation: This option matches the description: current warm/windy weather followed by rain later.

title: Reading 18: Surfing vs Skiing

subQuestions.q: What DON'T people wear to go skiing?
subQuestions.explanation: Swimsuits are for surfing, not skiing. Skiing requires warm clothing.

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) People in the old time didn't surf.
(D) We can surf at the place with a lot of snow.
subQuestions.explanation: The chart shows skiboards are used for skiing.

subQuestions.q: Why did the Sami ski?
subQuestions.explanation: The text in the image mentions the Sami skied to hunt.

title: Reading 19: Ann and Ken
article:
Ann: Hi, Ken! How was your trip to Taiwan?
Ken: It was great! The weather was good, so I visited a lot of beautiful places.
Ann: That's cool!
Ken: Right, I went to Yangmingshan and bought flowers for my Taiwanese friend there.
Ann: Really?
Ken: Here's a picture of my friend and me.
Ann: Wow! The flowers were really beautiful.
Ken: You can say that again.
Ann: Why were you in a pink T-shirt? You hate pink.
Ken: It was hot, but my T-shirts were heavy. My friend bought some cool T-shirts for me, and the pink T-shirt is one of them. They were my birthday gifts!
Ann: How nice!
Ken: Did you get my postcard from Taiwan?
Ann: Yes, I got it last week.

subQuestions.q: What did Ken's friends buy for his birthday?
subQuestions.explanation: Ken says, 'My friend bought some cool T-shirts for me... They were my birthday gifts!'

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) Ann had a trip to Taiwan.
(C) Ken bought flowers for Ann in Yangminshan.
(D) Ann got a postcard from Ken.
subQuestions.explanation: Ken asks if Ann got his postcard, and she confirms she did.

subQuestions.q: Which might be the conversation between Ken and his Taiwanese friend?
options: (A) Ken: Hello, Tina. Here are some pictures...
(B) Ken: It's so cold and it's rainy!...
(C) Tina: Happy Birthday, Ken. Ken: Can I open the gift now? Tina: Sure. Ken: Wow! T-shirts...
(D) Ken: Wow! The flowers here are beautiful...
subQuestions.explanation: Since the friend bought T-shirts as a birthday gift, conversation (C) about receiving T-shirts for a birthday fits best.

title: Reading 20: Fruit Recipes

subQuestions.q: Which recipe DOESN'T need salt?
subQuestions.explanation: Looking at the recipes: Strawberry (only chocolate), others list salt.

subQuestions.q: What can we know from the reading?
options: (A) We can eat yummy fruits in Taiwan.
(B) We don't need pepper for the recipe of pumpkins.
(C) We need sugar to make strawberries with chocolate.
(D) We can also put watermelon pieces on the apple pizza.
subQuestions.explanation: The text intro mentions Taiwan is famous for yummy fruits.

subQuestions.q: Which one had the apple pizza?
options: (A) Peter: Wow! It was so sweet...
(B) Judy: My friend and I had them together...
(C) Lisa: I baked some for my salad...
(D) Owen: This recipe is easy. My wife and I really enjoyed a pizza like this...
subQuestions.explanation: Owen mentions 'enjoyed a pizza like this', linking to the Apple Pizza recipe.
